title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality in the Depression-era South.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian social science fiction novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
summary: Explores the history of humankind from the Stone Age to the modern age.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A young man struggles with alienation, loss, and the meaning of life.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel about the American Dream and the life of Jay Gatsby.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A young shepherd’s journey to discover the treasure hidden in the Egyptian pyramids.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
summary: The memoir of former First Lady Michelle Obama, detailing her life and career.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and embarks on an adventure at a magical school.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
summary: Explores the science behind habit formation and how we can change our habits.

title: Shoe Dog
author: Phil Knight
summary: The memoir of Phil Knight, the co-founder of Nike, detailing the creation and rise of one of the most iconic sports brands in the world.

title: Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead
author: Sheryl Sandberg
summary: Sheryl Sandberg's book explores why women’s progress in achieving leadership roles has stalled and offers practical advice to help women achieve their career goals and become leaders.
